page.title: 07Shawforth Quarries
page.content:
Shawforth quarries produce stone which has been used for buildings and monuments in London. The quarry has been leased for 27 years by the Lord of the Manor to Mrs. Linda Haworth. She has seven employees.
They buy and dress second hand stone, some of which has been bought as building stone by famous people such as Paul McCartney and Norman Wisdom, and footballers Francis Lee and Colin Bell.
On the other side of the valley are the remains of Shawforth's coal mines which produced coal for the factories in Whitworth and Rossendale. Coal was extracted by digging in to the hill side as opposed to digging mine shafts.
